poem:
**Hell Jumpers**

Young hearts carried west to east,
Flame-etched in courage,
they leapt through smoke, ash whispered
of forsaken streets.

On paths where shadows reign,
unarmed, they strode
to gather the lost,
like angels veiled in mortal flesh.
Their steps marked by echoing bravery—
one leap
toward the light.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "TV tonight: the remarkable ‘hell jumpers’ rescuing Ukranians Hell Jumper 9pm, BBC TwoChris Parry was a 28-year-old from Cornwall who died in eastern Ukraine while trying to save a woman from heavy bombing. He was part of a group of young civilian evacuators – the “hell jumpers” – who went on rescue missions without military support. This moving and immersive documentary uses first-person footage and interviews with those involved about their work. Hollie Richardson Art". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: TV tonight: the remarkable ‘hell jumpers’ rescuing Ukranians Hell Jumper 9pm, BBC TwoChris Parry was a 28-year-old from Cornwall who died in eastern Ukraine while trying to save a woman from heavy bombing. He was part of a group of young civilian evacuators – the “hell jumpers” – who went on rescue missions without military support. This moving and immersive documentary uses first-person footage and interviews with those involved about their work. Hollie Richardson Art
